author: Sangeetha Kandavel
text:
Over the last five years the Tamil Nadu government has signed 131 Memorandum of Understanding (MoUs) with an aggregate investment of Rs 2.77 lakh crore, a record high. “This is a historical record investment received by the State,” according to a senior government official.

In May 2012, five MoUs were signed, entailing an amount of Rs 5,700 crore. The five companies including Daimler India, Yamaha Motor Limited, Ashok Leyland-Nissan Motor Company, Eicher Motors and Philips Carbon Black Limited gave a commitment that they would together create 9,530 jobs.

Six months later the government inked pacts with 12 companies envisaging investments to the tune of Rs 20,925 crore, which will generate direct employment for 36,855 persons and indirect employment for about 1 lakh persons. After a 13-month window period, the State roped in 16 projects involving investments of around Rs. 5,081 crore in February 2014.

“Two-third of these MoUs has translated into actual numbers and work has commenced,” the official said. “In September 2015, 98 MoUs worth Rs. 2, 42,160 crore were signed and many of them have gone live and some are waiting for clearances from the Guidance Bureau and Industries Department,” he added.

The official also said that the Foreign Direct Investment Equity inflow into the State has gone up in the last four years. “From April 2000 to April 2011 the cumulative FDI inflow into the State is USD 7,341 million. If you analyse the data from April 2000 to September 2015 the cumulative FDI inflow into the State is USD 18, 085 million. The difference is USD 10,744 million,” the official said.
title: ‘State govt. signed 131 MoUs in five years’
